net.hudup.core.alg.cf

Class NeighborCF

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.alg.AlgAbstract
      • net.hudup.core.alg.RecommenderAbstract
        • net.hudup.core.alg.MemoryBasedRecommenderAbstract
          • net.hudup.core.alg.cf.MemoryBasedCFAbstract
            • net.hudup.core.alg.cf.NeighborCF
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, java.util.EventListener, Alg, AlgRemote, MemoryBasedCF, MemoryBasedAlg, MemoryBasedRecommender, Recommender, RecommenderRemote, SetupAlgListener, SupportCacheAlg, Exportable, Inspectable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NeighborCFItemBased, NeighborCFUserBased

    public abstract class NeighborCF
extends MemoryBasedCFAbstract
implements SupportCacheAlg
    This class sets up the neighbor collaborative filtering (Neighbor CF) algorithm. It is memory-based CF because it extends directly MemoryBasedCF class. Neighbor CF algorithm finds out the nearest neighbor of active user (or active item). Later on, Neighbor CF algorithm recommends items that the nearest neighbor likes (rates with high value) to the active user, with assumption that the nearest neighbor and the active user (active item) share the same interests.
    The most important feature of any Neighbor CF algorithm is how to calculate the similarity between two rating vectors or between two profiles so as to find out the nearest neighbor. The nearest neighbor is the one who has highest similar measure with the active user (active item). This class provides the method sim(RatingVector, RatingVector, Profile, Profile, Object...) to calculate the similarity measure between two pairs. The first pair includes the first rating vector and the first profile. The second pair includes the second rating vector and the second profile. If you only want to calculate the similarity between two rating vectors, two in put profiles are set to be null. If you only want to calculate the similarity between two profiles, two in put rating vectors are set to be null. In current implementation, only three similarity measures are supported such as Pearson, cosine, and hybrid. Hybrid measure means that profile is merged into rating vector as a unified vector for calculating Pearson measure or cosine measure.

    There are many authors who contributed measure to this class.
    Authors Shuang-Bo Sun, Zhi-Heng Zhang, Xin-Ling Dong, Heng-Ru Zhang, Tong-Jun Li, Lin Zhang, and Fan Min contributed Triangle measure and TJM measure.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • isCachedSim

        protected boolean isCachedSim()
        Checking whether the supported similarity can be cached. In some case, the algorithm is cached but the similarity measure is not cached. In current version of this class, the method always returns true.
        Returns:
        true if the supported similarity can be cached.

      • sim

        public double sim(RatingVector vRating1,
                  RatingVector vRating2,
                  Profile profile1,
                  Profile profile2,
                  java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Calculating the similarity between two pairs. The first pair includes the first rating vector and the first profile. The second pair includes the second rating vector and the second profile. If you only want to calculate the similarity between two rating vectors, two in put profiles are set to be null. If you only want to calculate the similarity between two profiles, two in put rating vectors are set to be null. In current implementation, only three similarity measures are supported such as Pearson, cosine, and hybrid. Hybrid measure means that profile is merged into rating vector as a unified vector for calculating Pearson measure or cosine measure. In current implementation, hybrid measure is not supported.
        Parameters:
        vRating1 - first rating vector.
        vRating2 - second rating vector.
        profile1 - first profile.
        profile2 - second profile.
        parameters - extra parameters.
        Returns:
        similarity between both two RatingVector (s) and two Profile (s).

      • sim0

        protected double sim0(java.lang.String measure,
                      RatingVector vRating1,
                      RatingVector vRating2,
                      Profile profile1,
                      Profile profile2,
                      java.lang.Object... params)
        Calculating the similarity measure between two pairs as usual.
        Parameters:
        measure - specified measure.
        vRating1 - first rating vector.
        vRating2 - second rating vector.
        profile1 - first profile.
        profile2 - second profile.
        params - extra parameter.
        Returns:
        similarity between both two RatingVector (s) and two Profile (s) as usual.

The first pair includes the first rating vector and the first profile. The second pair includes the second rating vector and the second profile.

      • triangle

        protected double triangle(RatingVector vRating1,
                          RatingVector vRating2,
                          Profile profile1,
                          Profile profile2)
        Calculating the Triangle measure between two pairs. Shuang-Bo Sun, Zhi-Heng Zhang, Xin-Ling Dong, Heng-Ru Zhang, Tong-Jun Li, Lin Zhang, and Fan Min developed the Triangle measure. Loc Nguyen implements it. The first pair includes the first rating vector and the first profile. The second pair includes the second rating vector and the second profile.
        Parameters:
        vRating1 - first rating vector.
        vRating2 - second rating vector.
        profile1 - first profile.
        profile2 - second profile.
        Returns:
        Triangle measure between both two rating vectors and profiles.
